Rhea Perlman.

	Rhea Perlman was born March 31, 1948 in Brooklyn, NY. She was married to Danny DeVito for about 30 years before they separated in 2013.

questions.text: What did Diane ask Sam if she could start doing in the bar?
questions.explanation:
caricatures.

	Sam told Diane no. Diane ignored him and decided she was going to do it anyway.

questions.text: How did Coach keep the drinks straight?
options: He put them in a certain order on the tray
questions.explanation:
He named the glasses.

	The drinks Carla had were named Larry and Steve. He had some male and some female glasses. He told Carla that all of them "are completely different, except for the Wilson brothers."

Lisa.

	Lisa didn't believe she was very pretty and therefore has to settle for any man. Her father helped her see just how beautiful she really was.

Allyce Beasley.

	Allyce Beasley was born July 6, 1954 in Brooklyn, NY. She is best known for her role as Agnes DiPesto on "Moonlighting".

questions.text: What was the name of Coach's daughter's fiance?
questions.explanation:
Roy.

	Roy was played by Philip Charles MacKenzie. MacKenzie was born in 1947. He is best known for his role as Donald Maltby on "Brothers".

questions.text: What sport did Coach's daughter's fiance say he liked?
questions.explanation:
female full contact karate.

	He told Sam and Coach that baseball is a dead sport. He found it to be very boring and said people need action these days.

Yes.

	He smoked cigars. When Diane told him that the smell bothered her he said, "Yeah they smell awful but they taste great." This was one of the first times we saw just how obnoxious he really was.

questions.text: What did Coach's daughter's fiance sell?
questions.explanation:
suits.

	Sam asked him if he was wearing one of the suits now and he slipped into a sales pitch. He had the makings of a salesperson because he did not like to take no for an answer.

questions.text: What did Coach's daughter's fiance call Norm?
questions.explanation:
Chubbs.

	He was telling Norm and the others about the food at Melville's. He then commented to Norm, "What am I telling you for, Chubbs." Norm started to get up but Cliff had him sit back down.
